title: Executive Order 7930-Exemption of William H. Griffin From Compulsory Retirement for Age
content: Whereas, in my judgment, the public interest requires that William H. Griffin, senior engineer, Geological Survey, Department of the Interior, who was exempted from compulsory retirement for age for a period of one year ending July 31, 1938, by Executive Order No. 7667 of July 17, 1937, be further exempted from such compulsory retirement for a period of one year:

Now, Therefore, by virtue of and pursuant to the authority vested in me by section 204 of the act of June 30, 1932, 47 Stat. 382, 404 (U.S.C., title 5, sec. 715a), I hereby further exempt the said William H. Griffin from compulsory retirement for age for a period of one year ending July 31, 1939.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 7930-Exemption of William H. Griffin From Compulsory Retirement for Age Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/362904
